name: Andrew David Moore
body:
### Experience
1/2016-present  
>**Principal, DC Web Consultants LLC, Washington, DC**, [dcwebconsultants.com](http://dcwebconsultants.com)  
>Working with condo associations to customize member notice boards and document stores  
>Strengthening members section of allerg.qc.ca to include forum and ongoing CME activities  

2000–present  
>**Specialist in Allergy/Immunology, Baltimore/Washington, USA and Brossard, QC, Canada**  
>Facilitated and oversaw creation of physician user templates in electronic-medical records  
>Simplified general tech available to physician colleagues and staff  

1999-2001  
>**Physician Editor**, Conceptis Technologies (now **WebMD**, [theheart.org](http://theHeart.org)), Montréal, QC, Canada  
>Redesigned medical editing and multimedia template construction for CME web content  


### Appointments
2014-present  
>Member, **Canadian Internet Registration Authority**  

2012-present  
>Member, **Examination Committee Member in Clinical Immunology and Allergy**  
Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada  

2011-present  
>**L’Association des allergologues et immunologues du Québec**   
Executive member, Webmaster, [allerg.qc.ca](http://allerg.qc.ca)  

2009-2015  
>**Clinical teaching professor**, Université de Sherbrooke  
Department of Pediatrics, Division of Immunology and Allergy


###Education
2015-2016  
>Nanodegree in **Full-Stack Web Development**, [Udacity.com](http://udacity.com)  

2001  
>Seminars in **Presenting Data and Information**, by Edward Tufte  

1994-1999  
>**Fellowship and Residency**, Internal Medicine, Allergy and Clinical Immunology  
Montreal General Hospital (**McGill University**), Montréal, QC, Canada

1990-1994  
>**MDCM**, McGill University, Montréal, QC, Canada  

1986-1990  
>**B.Sc., honors**, Immunology and Mathematics, University of Toronto, Toronto, ON, Canada  


###Projects
02/2016  
>**Conference App** (As part of the Full Stack Web Developer Nanodegree program), on [GitHub](https://github.com/erooma/Conference-Application)  
● Improved upon an API server for a conference web (and native Android) application  
● Including: user authentication, profiles, conference information and data queries  
Skills: Google App Engine ● API Endpoints ● Datastore ● Python  

05/2013  
>**The 26th Scientific Bram Rose Conference**, Québec  
● “La technologie au service de notre pratique quotidienne”  
● Designed and implemented an online survey for members in advance of presentation  
Skills: HTML ● JavaScript ● Public speaking ● PowerPoint  

2011-present  
>**Website for the Association of Allergists and Immunologists of Québec**, [allerg.qc.ca](http://allerg.qc.ca)  
● Created an online-home for the Association of Allergists and Immunologists of Québec  
● Designed for patients, health-professionals and Allergist members including a native CMS  
● A crucial factor in recertification of our specialty by Québec and Canadian authorities  
Skills: HTML ● CSS ● JavaScript ● PHP  

1999-2001  
>**Multimedia Online Conferences**, [theheart.org](http://theheart.org)  
● Created and implemented CME online conferences in cardiology and rheumatology  
Skills: HTML ● Photoshop ● PowerPoint ● SoundForge  


### Skills
>**Languages** (spoken and written)  
English ● French   

>**Coding languages and frameworks**  
HTML ● CSS ● JavaScript ● PHP ● Bootstrap ● jQuery ● Python ● Flask  
SQL ● MySQL ● PostgreSQL  



### Research Support – Grants
2009-2014	
>Co-Applicant, Public Health Agency of Canada (PHAC)  
Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) Influenza Research Network (PCIRN)  
Dr. S. Halperin, Nominated Principal Applicant. 

1998
>Co-Principal Investigator, Incidence of malignancy in patients with SLE  
Lupus Québec, Montréal, QC, Canada


### Research - Clinical Trials

2013-2015		
>Principal Investigator, Charles LeMoyne Hospital  
Clinical Trials in Sublingual Immunotherapy for the Treatment of Perennial Allergic Rhinitis

2010-2015
>Principal Investigator, Charles LeMoyne Hospital  
Clinical Investigation of Anaphylaxis Following H1N1 Influenza Vaccination

2001-2005
>Principal Investigator, ENTAA Care, Glen Burnie, MD, USA  
Clinical Trials and Safety Studies in:  childhood exercise-induced asthma;  
adult asthma; allergic rhinitis; acute sinusitis and community acquired pneumonia


### Professional and Community Service
2012-present		
>Expert Advisory Committee on the Vigilance of Health Products (EAC-VHP)   
Committee member representing the healthcare professional sector  
Health Products and Food Branch, Health Canada

2011-present
>L’Association des allergologues et immunologues du Québec  
Webmaster, [allerg.qc.ca](http://allerg.qc.ca)			

2011-present
>L’Association Québécoise des allergies alimentaires  
Scientific advisory board member 
 	
2008-2015
>Speaker, Merck Canada  

2007-2015
>Comité de pharmacologie et de thérapeutique   
Member, Charles LeMoyne Hospital

2006-2013
>Speaker, Medical consultant, Pfizer Canada (previously, King Pharma)

2013
>Medical consultant, Sanofi

2012
>Scientific advisory board member, Viro Pharma

2007-2009
>Speaker, Medical consultant, Nycomed Canada (previously, Altana)

2002-2005
>North Arundel Hospital and ENTAA Care, Severna Park, Maryland  
“Camp Airways”, a day-camp for children with asthma

1999-2001
>Ad Hoc Committee for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) Response Criteria  
Member, Working Group of the American College of Rheumatology

1998-1999
>President, Canadian Allergy and Clinical Immunology Fellows’ Association 



### Professional and Community Presentations
2014	
>Medical grand rounds, Charles LeMoyne Hospital, Greenfield Park, QC  
*Les désensibilisations en allergie* : modus operandi
	
>Congrès Québécois en santé respiratoire, Montréal, QC  
*Les allergies respiratoires*

>Association des Patients Immunodéficients du Québec, Québec, QC  
*Comment traiter l’angioédème?*
	
>L’Association pulmonaire du Québec, Café de la Cinémathèque Québécoise, Montréal, QC  
*La Rhinite Allergique, toujours en saison*
	
>CSSS Richelieu-Yamaska, Ville de Saint-Hyacinthe, QC  
*Allergies et immunothérapie*

2013	
>Association des Patients Immunodéficients du Québec, Longueuil, QC  
*Qu’est-ce que l’angioédème?*
	
>The 26th Scientific Bram Rose Conference, Québec, QC  
*La technologie au service de notre pratique quotidienne*
	
2012 	
>McGill Continuing Health Professional Education  
Online “Wednesday E-learning series”, *Food and Environmental Allergies*

2007	
>Medical grand rounds, Charles LeMoyne Hospital, Greenfield Park, QC  
*Les allergies alimentaires*
	
2006
>Medical grand rounds, Charles LeMoyne Hospital, Greenfield Park, QC  
*Le nouveau traitement anti-IgE pour les maladies allergiques*
	
2004
>Medical grand rounds, Kingston General Hospital, Kingston, Ontario  
*Recent Advances in the Management of IgE Mediated Hypersensitivity*

2003	
>Pediatric grand rounds, Anne Arundel Medical Center, Annapolis, Maryland  
*Update on Pediatric Asthma*

1998
>Moore AD, Petri MA, Manzi S, Isenberg DA, Gordon C, Senecal JL, St. Pierre Y, Joseph L, Fortin PR, Sutcliffe N, Goulet JR, Choquette D, Grodzicky T, Esdaile E, Clarke AE, “Interpersonal support and health status in systemic lupus erythematosus [abstract, presentation]”, Quality Life Res 1998;7:640

>Moore AD, Petri MA, Manzi S, Isenberg DA, Gordon C, Senecal JL, St. Pierre Y, Fortin PR, Sutcliffe N, Goulet JR, Choquette D, Grodzicky T, Esdaile JM, Clarke AE, “The use of alternative medical therapies in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus [abstract, presentation]”, Arthritis Rheum 1998;41:S133	

1996
>Moore AD, Clarke AE, Danoff DS, Neville C, Fortin PR, “Can utility measures be used in lupus research? A validation and reliability study [abstract, presentation]”, Arthritis Rheum 1996;39:S322 


###Abstracts
2005
>Moore AD, Ominsky B, Shochet M, Jacobs SL, “Selective Ig-A deficiency and Mycobacterium kansasii infection [abstract]”, Allergy Asthma Clin Immunol 2005;1:111

1999
>Moore AD, Petri MA, Manzi S, Isenberg DA, Gordon C, Senecal JL, St. Pierre Joseph L, Penrod J, Fortin PR, Sutcliffe N, Goulet JR, Choquette D, Grodzicky T, Esdaile JM, Clarke AE, “Alternative medicine reflects care seeking behaviour in SLE [abstract]”,  Arthritis Rheum 1999;42:S327	

1998
>Ferland D, Moore AD, Clarke AE, Belisle P, Joseph L, Fortin PR, “Frequency of lupus flares over four years [abstract]”, J Rheumatol 1998;25(S52);74

>Moore AD, Ferland D, Calrke AE, Belisle P, St. Pierre Y, Joseph L, Penrod J, Fortin PR; “The direct costs of a flare in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) [abstract]”, Arthritis Rheum 1998;41:S228

>Fortin PR, Ferland D, Moore AD, Belisle P, Joseph L, Clarke AE; “Rates and predictors of lupus flares” [abstract]”, Arthritis Rheum 1998;41:S218


### Publications
>Rouleau I, De Serres G, Drolet JP, Banerjee D, Lemire C, Moore A, Paradis L, Alizadhefar R, Des Roches A, Chan ES, Stark D, Benoit M, Skowronski DM, On behalf of the PCIRN (Public Health Agency of Canada-Canadian
Institutes for Health Research Influenza Research) Network.  “Allergic symptoms after pandemic influenza
vaccination rarely mediated by vaccine specific IgE”, J Allergy Clin Immunol 2012;130:1423-1426

>Ben-Shoshan M, Moore A, Primeau M-N, “Anaphylactic reaction to Clarithromycin in a child”, Allergy 2009;64:962-963

>Bernatsky S, Joseph L, Bélisle P, Boivin J-F, Rajan R, Moore A, Clarke A. “Bayesian modelling of imperfect ascertainment methods in cancer studies”, Stat Med 2005;24:2365-2379

>ACR Ad Hoc Committee on SLE Response Criteria. “The American College of Rheumatology response criteria for systemic lupus erythematosus: Measures of overall disease activity”, Arthritis Rheum 2004;50:3418-3426

>Ad Hoc Working Group on Steroid-Sparing Criteria in Lupus. “Criteria for steroid sparing ability of interventions in systemic lupus erythematosus: Report of a consensus meeting”, Arthritis Rheum 2004;50:3427-3431

>Bernatsky S, Ramsey-Goldman R, Gordon C, Joseph L, Boivin JF, Rajan R, Allen A, Moore AD, Leung M-H, Clarke A. “Factors associated with abnormal Pap results in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)”, Rheumatology 2004;43:1386-1389

>Bernatsky S, Clarke A, Ramsey-Goldman R, Joseph L, Boivin J-F, Rajan R, Moore AD, Leung M-H, Angela Allen, Gordon C. “Hormonal exposures and breast cancer in a sample of women with systemic lupus erythematosus”, Rheumatology 2004;43:1178-1181

>Bernatsky S, Ramsey-Goldman R, Boivin J-F, Joseph L, Moore AD, Rajan R, Clarke A. “Do traditional Gail model risk factors account for increased breast cancer in women with lupus?”, J Rheumatol 2003;30:1505-1507

>Bernatsky S, Boivin JF, Joseph L, St. Pierre Y, Moore A, Rajan R, Clarke A. “Prevalence of factors influencing cancer risk in women with lupus: Social habits, reproductive issues, and obesity”, J Rheumatol 2002;29:2551-2554

>Moore AD, Petri MA, Manzi S, Isenberg DA, Gordon C, Senecal JL, St. Pierre Y, Joseph L, Penrod J, Fortin PR, Sutcliffe N, Goulet JR, Choquette D, Grodzicky T, Esdaile JM, Clarke AE. “The use of alternative medical therapies in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)”, Arthritis Rheum 2000;43:1410-1418

>Moore AD, Joseph L. “Sample size considerations for superiority trials in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)”, Lupus 1999;8:612-619

>Moore AD, Clarke AE, Danoff DS, Joseph L, Bélisle P, Neville C, Fortin PR. “Can health utility measures be used in lupus research? A comparative validation and reliability study of four utility indices”, J Rheumatol 1999;26:1285-1290
